# Enverge Lab - Fine-tune demo with Unsloth

See the notebook in action: 

[![Launch in Enverge.ai](https://img.shields.io/badge/Launch_on-Enverge.ai-green?style=flat&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](http://lab.enverge.ai/open?repo=git@github.com:Enverge-Labs/unsloth_demo.git&notebook=finetune_demo.py)

This is support material for a video how-to guide for fine-tuning a model with Unsloth on Enverge Lab. Read more [about Enverge here](https://enverge.ai).

The video itself can be seen here:

<div>
  <a href="https://www.loom.com/share/d25722787b9244f383321d0fcae7ef47">

  </a>

  </a>
</div>

# Notebook code

Checkout the notebook itself un the `finetune_demo.py` file.

# Additional Resources

1. [Understanding Supervised Fine-tuning LLMs](https://cameronrwolfe.substack.com/p/understanding-and-using-supervised)
2. [Gretel.ai Dataset](https://huggingface.co/datasets/gretelai/synthetic_text_to_sql)
3. [More info about prompt formats](https://docs.predictionguard.com/options/prompts)
4. [Longer tutorial with more details from @pookie](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lt7KrFMcCis) on YouTube
5. [Official Unsloth notebook covering fine-tuning](https://huggingface.co/datasets/unsloth/notebooks/blob/main/Alpaca_%2B_Llama_7b_full_example.ipynb), although in a more convoluted format.
